summary: The Supersonic Aviation Modernization Act aims to permit civil supersonic flights within the national airspace system without special authorization, provided sonic booms do not reach the ground in the United States. The bill mandates the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to update regulations within one year of enactment to accommodate these flights. Its goal is to allow for operation of civil aircraft at speeds exceeding Mach 1, offering potential advancements in air travel.
